member.name: T:csammisrun.OscarLib.Utility.StreamSocket
member.summary:
The StreamSocket class can be used for network communication and is a mix of the following classes: Socket, NetworkStream, SslStream. It's accessable Methods and Properties are a selection of this three classes. The type of the class you can set with , Ssl or Default. If Ssl is selected please don't forget to "Authenticate" after connecting.
It's very important, that you DON'T use any kind Exceptions from like SocketException for "Read" and "Write". Maybe it's better to use the standard Exception for the StreamSocket class.

member.name: T:csammisrun.OscarLib.Utility.Marshal
member.summary: The Marshal class contains utility functions to aid in marshalling and unmarshalling data into OSCAR-compatable format.

remarks.para: The BitConverter class was not used to aid in byte-array-to-data-type functions due to the endian-ness of the data. As an example, consider the following byte array: byte[] buffer = new byte[] {0x00,0x01,0x02,0x03}; When asked to create a ushort from the first two bytes in the array, BitConverter will return 128 (0x0100) as opposed to 1 (0x0001). The OSCAR protocol expects byte buffers to be read left-to-right, in network order format.

member.name: M:csammisrun.OscarLib.Utility.Marshal.EncodingToAolMime(System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Gets a byte array containing the AOL representation of the specified Encoding
member.param: The to convert
member.returns: A byte array containing the US-ASCII string of the encoding
member.remarks:
This function supports:
-- text/aolrtf; charset="us-ascii"
-- text/aolrtf; charset="unicode-2-0"
ISO-8859-1 (Latin1) -- text/aolrtf; charset="iso-8859-1"
Other -- text/aolrtf; charset="[webname]", where [webname] is the of the argument

member.name: M:csammisrun.OscarLib.MessageManager.SendMessage(System.String,System.String,csammisrun.OscarLib.OutgoingMessageFlags,System.Collections.Generic.List{csammisrun.OscarLib.Attachment})
member.summary: Sends an instant message
member.param: The screenname to receive the IM
The message to send
A enumeration specifying what additional information should be sent with the message
A list of s to send with the message

remarks.para: Delivery confirmation results or sending errors will be returned in the event.

If any attachments are specified in the list, this method will attempt to open a Direct Connection, a peer-to-peer connection that could expose the local IP address to the other participant in the conversation. If a Direct Connection cannot be established, this method will not attempt to send the message without the attachments. The event will be raised, and the client should attempt to send the message without attachments manually.

member.exception: Thrown when the is not logged in

member.name: M:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServiceManager.SendVerificationResponse
member.summary: Sends a response to a client verification request -- SNAC(01,20)
member.remarks: SNAC(01,1F) and SNAC(01,20) are used to verify that the client connecting to the network was the official AOL Instant Messenger. The server sends two integers, an offset and a length, in SNAC(01,1F). These parameters are then used to get 16 bytes of data in the offical client's static memory region. However, after AOL begain using this authentication method, the servers never changed the requested offset and length. The expected response was the same 16 bytes every time, which made it a fairly ineffective deterrent to "unauthorized" clients.

member.name: M:csammisrun.OscarLib.Session.Logon(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Begins the process of logging in to the OSCAR service
member.param: The OSCAR login server
The OSCAR service port
Use ssl protocol

remarks.para: This function is non-blocking, because the login process does not happen instantly. The OSCAR library will raise the event when the login process has finished successfully.
The OSCAR library raises periodic status update events throughout the login process via the event.
Errors may occur during the login process; if an error occurs, the OSCAR library raises the event, and stops the remaining login sequence.

member.exception: Thrown when the is already logged in

member.name: M:csammisrun.OscarLib.Session.HashPassword(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Returns an MD5 hash of the client's password, an authorization key, and a constant string
member.param: The authorization key sent by the server
member.returns: A 16-byte MD5 hash

remarks.para:
The hashing process is fairly simple:
The authorization key is put into a buffer
The password itself is hashed via MD5 and appended to the buffer
The constant string, "AOL Instant Messenger (SM)", is appended to the buffer in plaintext
The entire buffer is MD5 hashed and returned to the caller
This method exists to prevent the password from having to be passed around in a data structure

member.name: P:csammisrun.OscarLib.Session.ScratchPath
member.summary: Gets or sets a filesystem path where OscarLib can place received data

member.name: T:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode
member.summary: Describes the potential errors the AOL servers can report during login

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.InvalidScreennamePassword
member.summary: The screenname is unrecognized or not in a format recognized by OSCAR, or the password does not match the screenname
member.remarks: The OSCAR server could send either this or to indicate a bad username and/or password

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.ServiceUnavailable
member.summary: A necessary OSCAR service is unavailable

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.UnknownError
member.summary: The server has experienced an unknown error

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.IncorrectScreennamePassword
member.summary: The screenname is unrecognized or not in a format recognized by OSCAR, or the password does not match the screenname
member.remarks: The OSCAR server could send either this or to indicate a bad username and/or password

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.WrongPassword
member.summary: The password is incorrect
member.remarks: Logging in with ICQ accounts has returned 0x0005 for login failed when the password is wrong

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.BadAuthorizationInfo
member.summary: The client sent incorrect authorization sequences

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.AccountInvalid
member.summary: The account has become invalidated

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.AccountDeleted
member.summary: The AOL admins have deleted the account

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.AccountExpired
member.summary: The account has expired

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.DatabaseNoAccess
member.summary: The server has experienced an internal error

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.ResolverNoAccess
member.summary: The server has experienced an internal error

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.DatabaseInvalidFields
member.summary: The server has experienced an internal error

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.DatabaseBadStatus
member.summary: The server has experienced an internal error

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.ResolverBadStatus
member.summary: The server has experienced an internal error

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.InternalError
member.summary: The server has experienced an internal error

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.ServiceOffline
member.summary: The server has experienced an internal error

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.AccountSuspended
member.summary: The account has been suspended for activity against the Terms of Service

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.DatabaseSendError
member.summary: The server has experienced an internal error

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.DatabaseLinkError
member.summary: The server has experienced an internal error

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.ReservationMapError
member.summary: The server has experienced an internal error

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.ReservationLinkError
member.summary: The server has experienced an internal error

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.ReservationTimeout
member.summary: The server has experienced an internal error

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.TooManyUsersFromIP
member.summary: Too many accounts are logged in from the same external IP address

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.RateLimitExceeded
member.summary: The account has attempted to log in too frequently in a span of time

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.WarningLevelTooHigh
member.summary: The account's warning level is too high to allow login

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.OldICQVersion
member.summary: The client is using an outdated version of the ICQ protocol

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.CantRegisterICQ
member.summary: The ICQ number cannot be registered on the network

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.InvalidSecurID
member.summary: An AOL admin account has provided an invalid SecurID for authentication

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.AccountSuspendedBecauseOfAge
member.summary: The AOL admins have started reading your mail and realized you're < 13 years old in real life

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.CantReachAuthServer
member.summary: The authorization server cannot be reached
member.remarks: This is the first server to which OSCAR clients connect. The first thing to check if this error code is received is to ensure that your network is functioning correctly. After that, it's AOL's fault.

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.LoginErrorCode.CantReachBOSServer
member.summary: The Basic OSCAR Service server cannot be reached
member.remarks: This is the server to which a client is redirected after successful authentication. Failure to connect to the BOS server is due to an OSCAR service outage. Note that there are many BOS servers; some screennames may be able to connect when others cannot.

member.name: T:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode
member.summary: Describes the potential errors the AOL servers can report during an active session

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.InvalidSNACHeader
member.summary: Malformed SNAC header

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.ServerRateLimited
member.summary: The server cannot send messages as fast as the client is requesting them

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.ClientRateLimited
member.summary: The local client has been rate limited

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.ReceiverNotLoggedIn
member.summary: The recepient of a message or request is not logged into the network

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.RequestedServiceUnavailable
member.summary: A secondary service is not available

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.RequestedServiceUnknown
member.summary: The requested secondary service does not exist

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.ObsoleteSNAC
member.summary: The client sent a SNAC that is no longer supported

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.NotSupportedByServer
member.summary: The server does not support the requested feature

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.NotSupportedByClient
member.summary: The client has reported during authentication that it does not support a given feature

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.RefusedByClient
member.summary: The remote client has refused the message

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.ReplyTooBig
member.summary: The server's reply was too large to transmit

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.ResponsesLost
member.summary: The response to a query was lost by the system

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.RequestDenied
member.summary: The server has denied the client's request

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.InvalidSNACFormat
member.summary: Malformed SNAC packet contents

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.InsufficientRights
member.summary: The client does not have sufficient rights to send a message
member.remarks: This most likely refers to administrator functions such as SecureID

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.ReceiverBlocked
member.summary: The server will not relay the message because the receiver has been blocked by the sender

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.SenderWarningTooHigh
member.summary: The server will not relay the message because the sender's warning level is too high

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.ReceiverWarningTooHigh
member.summary: The server will not relay the message because the receiver's warning level is too high

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.UserUnavailable
member.summary: The remote user was unavailable
member.remarks: This error has been encountered when attempting to send an IM to a user via SNAC04 during an existing Direct Connection session with the same user

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.NoMatch
member.summary: No match to request

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.ListOverflow
member.summary: Internal server error: A list has overflowed

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.AmbiguousRequest
member.summary: The client's request specified an ambiguous target

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.ServerQueueFull
member.summary: The server is not currently accepting new messages

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.NotOnAOL
member.summary: Operation can't be performed while connected via AOL

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.LostSecondaryConnection
member.summary: A secondary service connection (chat, buddy icons, etc.) has been lost

member.name: F:csammisrun.OscarLib.ServerErrorCode.LostBOSConnection
member.summary: The primary service connection has been lost

member.name: M:csammisrun.OscarLib.UtilityMethods.FindBestOscarEncoding(System.String)
member.summary: Scans an input string to determine its best-fit OSCAR-supported encoding
member.param: An input string to be scanned
member.returns: A text encoding with which to encode the string; see Remarks

remarks.para: OSCAR supports three text encodings: ASCII, ISO-8859-1, and UTF16-BE. In order to minimize outgoing message length, this method finds the best-fit encoding for the string.
